title: Global Size of Reverse Logistics Market Envisaged to Reach USD 2,986.17 Billion By 2032, at 12.3% CAGR Growth ... - PR Newswire
summary: The global reverse logistics market is projected to reach USD 2,986.17 Billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 12.3%. Reverse logistics involves managing the flow of products from consumption to origin, including recycling and disposal, and is driven by increasing sustainability concerns and e-commerce growth. The market is experiencing growth due to collaborations among industry players, effective disposal of non-reusable products, and rising focus on sustainable initiatives.

title: Reverse Logistics Market Size & Share, Growth Trends 2023-2032 - Global Market Insights
summary: The reverse logistics market is growing rapidly, driven by increasing e-commerce, stricter regulations regarding waste disposal, and a growing focus on sustainability.  Companies are seeking ways to optimize their reverse logistics processes to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and manage returns effectively.  These efforts include embracing circular economy principles and adopting new technologies for handling returned products.

title: NewRoad Capital Partners hires former Walmart exec Bob Arvin - talkbusiness.net
summary: NewRoad Capital Partners, a private equity fund, has hired Bob Arvin, a former supply chain executive at Walmart, as a strategic advisor. Arvin brings over 45 years of experience in logistics and supply chain, particularly in reverse logistics. His expertise will help NewRoad invest in companies developing innovative solutions in the rapidly growing reverse logistics sector.
product_or_process: Reverse logistics solutions and sustainability programs

title: Stellantis SUSTAINera at MEMA Sustainability Summit: Circular Economy business plays key role in global ... - Stellantis.com
summary: Stellantis, a leading automaker, is implementing a circular economy strategy called SUSTAINera, focused on the 4Rs: Remanufacturing, Repair, Reuse, and Recycle. This strategy aims to reduce environmental impact and achieve carbon net zero by 2038. SUSTAINera offers remanufactured parts,  resulting in up to 80% raw material savings and 50% reduced CO2 emissions compared to new parts.
